title: Defensive formations, respecting possession and canny replacements: How do teams cope with going down to 14 men?
text:
So, as of Tuesday evening, there has been a total of 17 yellow cards and six reds since the start of Rugby World Cup 2019 at the end of last month.

Even before the pool stages have finished, we are already in uncharted territory for sending-offs. The current tournament has surpassed the previous high of four red cards in both 1995 and 1999.

Over 29 matches so far, 303 minutes have been played with one team reduced to 14 men – and that is not accounting for sequences that have continued while a sin-binned player has been ready to return.

Courtesy of Samoa’s crazy period in Kumagaya against Russia, during which centre Rey Lee-Lo and hooker Motu Matu’u were fortunate to see only yellow for two wild...
